headline: Wall Street Lunch: 3rd Straight FOMC Cut, But Dissents Grow
summary: As widely expected, the Federal Open Market Committee reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points on Wednesday, its third straight cut.

headline: Micron Stock Rises. Wall Street Is Feeling Good About Next Week’s Earnings.
summary: Micron Technology  is set to report fiscal first-quarter earnings next week, and many on Wall Street have high expectations for the chip maker that has reaped the benefits of the artificial-intelligence boom.  One of those bulls is Citi Research analyst Christopher Danely, who lifted his price target on Micron shares to $300 from $275 and reiterated a Buy rating in a note published Tuesday.  Danely expects Micron to report quarterly revenue of $14 billion, handily above the $12.59 billion Wall Street is anticipating, “due to unprecedented increases in DRAM pricing.”

headline: AI Chips Update - AI-Driven Cybersecurity Surge Amid Rising Threats
summary: Recent developments in AI-integrated cybersecurity solutions have intensified as enterprises face a surge in AI-weaponized cyberattacks, up 156% by late 2025. Many companies are urgently enhancing security frameworks with quantum-resistant cryptography and zero trust architectures to address this evolved threat landscape. Highlighted solutions include Quantum Secure Encryption Corp's (QSE) launch of the qREK Software Development Kit, which empowers developers with tools for quantum-resilient...

headline: AI Memory Chipmaker SK Hynix Weighs US Listing to Lift Valuation
summary: The rare move by a South Korean company also aligns with President Lee Jae Myung administration’s broader push to boost corporate value.  SK Hynix is “reviewing various measures to enhance corporate value, including a potential listing on the US stock market using treasury shares, but nothing has been finalized at this time,” it said in a regulatory filing.
